did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Cumberland County (Va.), Public Buildings and Grounds, 1834, 1874

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cumberland County (Va.). Public Buildings and Grounds, 1834, 1874. Barcode number 1156186. Local government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Cumberland County Circuit Court.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Please serve ink jet copy located in the LVA General Architectural Files Collection, Folder 144. Accession 41044.>

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Cumberland County was formed from Goochland County in 1749.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Cumberland County (Va.) Public Buildings and Grounds, 1834, 1874. This material consists of an 1834 document showing specifications and a small elevation and floor plan drawing for a building to house the County Court Clerk's office. The specifications are signed by J. W. Wilson, John Daniel, and Joseph Fuqua.

Also included is an 1874 document consisting of two sheets of specifications. One of the sheets shows a floor plan for the arrangement of the courtroom giving the location of the bench, bar, stoves, windows, doors, chairs, etc. These sheets are signed by William J. Davis, B. B. Woodson, and William Fuqua.
